speaker: Hudson
lines: My name is Hudson. I’m the engineer of this train.

lines: Walking through the passenger car, you only see three other passengers.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Hello, I’m Jenkins.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: I’m the wizard attendant on the Rockport Limited.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I saw a dwarven woman in there, and I swear I recognized her, but I can’t remember her name—

speaker: Jenkins

speaker: Magnus
lines: Oh!

speaker: Merle
lines: Mmm…

speaker: Jenkins
lines: This is a… the, the Pleasure Chamber, it is not a sex thing, eh, maybe it can be. I can make it so that when you enter this chamber you can be in any room, anywhere in the world that you want to be.

speaker: Angus
lines: Hello my name is Angus! I’m a little boy. I’m going to visit my grandpa in Neverwinter.

speaker: Graham
lines: I can tell you that my name is Graham. It’s not as fun. I still sound like the boy that you were just talking to.

speaker: Justin
lines: I was about to say!

speaker: Magnus
lines: You have a youthful energy about you.

speaker: Announcer
lines: This week someone reaches their final destination Heaven. All aboard The Adventure Zone!

lines: Ah… The three of you have just been served a scrumptious brunch service by a very reluctant Jenkins.

lines: Ok so—

lines: [laughs] Ok, good.

lines: Hey, then that— that helps. We’ll check back with the judges on cookie point allocation after the recording of this episode of the podcast that we do.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uhhm. But in— in the gameworld you’ve just enjoyed a delicious brunch that Jenkins reluctantly served you— uhh, and you’ve been on the train now for about an hour and a half. Umm… Jenkins checks back in on you, uh, and asks, uh

lines: Have you… given any more thought to—

speaker: Griffin
lines: See I can’t do it this good this week, my throat’s not as… ragged.

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Have you given any more thought to a pleasure chamber? You might want to, ah, visit? I can take you to one of my own personal favorites, I can take you to… a beautiful day spa where you will be covered in the richest yoghurt [British pronunciation] and… well you won’t be massaged cause nobody else will be there but it’s like a yoghurt… dip—

lines: Jenkins?

speaker: Jenkins
lines: Yes?

lines: I- if you… If— if— You could visit a room in— in— in my mother’s—

lines: You could visit- Oh, I see.

lines: Is this an actual request or just one of your patented burns?

lines: Nah, Jenkins, nah. We cool.

lines: Oh, I can do that for you.

lines: Uh, he removes from his, uh, pocket? I guess? From within his robe, we’ll say, he withdraws a small rod, um, a small cylindrical—

lines: God damn it!

lines: He— he whips it out and, umm [Clint laughs] it’s basically just like a, uh, a very plain looking silvery… umm… rod. I don’t know— I don’t know what to— to call it.

lines: When he turns—

I don’t know if this is any of your jams, maybe Merle with your proclivity towards, uh, the natural world…

lines: Yeah!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are— are you particularly moved by… I don’t wanna put— put, uh, feelings in your heart or words in your mouth, uh, but a—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

lines: Are you ask me for my—

lines: Are they— are they going too or is this a solo mish?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Umm, so the three of you wander into this beautiful botanical garden. It’s very relaxing. There’s, uh— It’s a little disorienting at first, being on a like a high speed train and then being in a stationary sort of room. Um, but uh, yeah, you aren’t too bothered by that because it’s— it smells great in here. Uh, the—

lines: [crosstalk] No, please, go ahead.

lines: [crosstalk] Oh. This is like a Stargate situation.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, kind of. Uh—

lines: Yeah. There’s— there’s a clearly defined, uh— On- on your side of the door in the, um, botanical garden, you see the same door frame from the train, uh, that is now behind you, and- and through it you can see the dining car, you can see Jenkins holding his rod and p— don’t—

lines: Yep. [Travis sighs disappointedly]

speaker: Griffin

lines: Enjoy yourselves. Please don’t take too long. Uh, and remember, don’t leave anything behind, and you cannot take anything with you.

lines: Well, yes, it would have to be.

lines: It says here, “super cool.” It’s super cool, according to the manual.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This is not illusion magic. It’s not— he has not created a fake version of this botanical garden. This is conjuration magic, uh, which is the school of magic that teleportation magic belongs to. So this is, this is honest-to-god teleportation but a very limited form of it.

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, it’s, it’s, it’s incredibly, incredibly difficult for, uh, wizards to teleport proper, right? To actually go from one place to the other and just be there. This is a sort of limited, easier-to-use version of teleportation where, uh, you cannot sort of permanently displace yourself from point to the other, and that’s- that is why there are those limitations.

lines: And if, if teleportation magic is hard for wizards to use, it must be impossible for Jenkinses.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, you enjoy the floral pleasure chamber for a little while, and then return back to the, uh, dining car. Um, Jenkins retreats towards the front of the car to continue his, his stewardly business. lines: “Detect Magic. For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic if any.”

lines: Uh, arcana, uh, measures your ability to recall lore about spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, the planes of existence and the inhabitants of those planes. Uh, you uh, using your- your arcana, which you’re going to roll now before I actually tell you what happens—

lines: And does it like, stick around, like—?

lines: And, actually, funny you ask, as you pick it up, the book, and open it up to figure it out, the book sort of magically responds, and you can read the last message that was deciphe—that was uh, intercepted by the book, and it reads, um

lines: Leeman Kessler and Co. not who they say they are. STOP Charm magic spell performed at the station. STOP Hand over to authorities immediately upon arrival in Neverwinter. STOP

lines: Mhm, mhm.

lines: Listen, Angus—

lines: I hold up my book, my, my Extreme Teen Bible, a, a bright, clear, crystal blue sheen erupts from it—

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait—is it clear, or is it crystal blue?

speaker: Clint
lines: Yes.

speaker: Travis
lines: [laughs] Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s crystal clear, blue, bluish, with a slight bluish tint.

speaker: Travis
lines: [crosstalk] Translucent.

speaker: Justin
lines: Uh, Griff, are we able to tell like what it— does the crab seem organic, or robotic, or what is it?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, it’s organic. It’s, uh, it is, it’s not, uh, an automaton? Ah, it is… uh—

speaker: Justin
lines: You know how Travis feels about those.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. [chuckles]

speaker: Travis
lines: How big is it? Like compare it to an animal?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, it is… the size of… a… hm… That’s a great question Travis. Sort of a Galapagos Turtle.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh, that would hurt.

speaker: Griffin
lines: What would?

speaker: Clint
lines: If it— if it pinched us.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah. It was not, it doesn’t have pincers, as much as it has these long, razor sharp claws. And uh, a mouth that is very big, and has lots of teeth like a Sarlacc.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh-kay!

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, but there’s still good meat in there, I’m tellin ya.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Oh, for sure, for sure, for sure.

speaker: Clint
lines: Ooh.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, okay, Merle are you done? You’re not moving?

speaker: Clint
lines: That’s it. I'm, I’m not moving.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay! The three of you are just standing shoulder to shoulder then, I guess, uh, it is now the crab’s turn. Uh, he scuttles towards the three of you… uh, sort of rotates his body and rears back on one of his claws—

speaker: Travis
lines: Mmhm.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —and swings one claw each at all three of you.

speaker: Justin
lines: Sweet.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, that’s a cool look.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Just sort of just a, just sort of a raking attack. Uh, we’ll start with… uh, we’ll start with Merle.

speaker: Clint
lines: Now which one do I roll?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m rolling to attack your AC.

speaker: Clint
lines: Alright.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, that is a 17.

speaker: Clint
lines: Yeah, 18 is my armor class.

speaker: Justin
lines: It actually is 20 right now, right?

speaker: Clint
lines: Oh that’s right, yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay, so his uh, claw just sort of… uh, grazes you and just sort of glances off your pauldrons of your chainmail armor. Uh, the next claw comes down on Taako, and that is…ooh, goddamn, uh, 24?

speaker: Taako
lines: Just barely.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, and I’ll go ahead and roll the attack on Merle too to see if it hits. Uhh, that is a… 18.

speaker: Travis
lines: Wait, on me you mean?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, I’m sorry, Magnus.

speaker: Travis
lines: My AC right now is 19, thank you Merle.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, ok. Uh, so Taako, you are the only one that got hit by that, and you take… Ooh, six… plus eight, 14 damage. As he rakes it across your chest.

speaker: Travis
lines: Um, am I- am I correct in thinking that without my shield I can’t do…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, you can’t — I think that’s true.

speaker: Travis
lines: I think that’s true too.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I’m gonna say it’s true cause how— what the fuck, what are you gonna do. Jump in front of it like, uh, in the line of fire?

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean I will, I’ll take that damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: No. Uh, Taako took that damage — 14 damage — to the Taako.

speaker: Justin
lines: Wait, how many?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, 14. Listen, you guys are level- what, level 4 now? You can take a— you can take a beating. Fourteen’s nothing. [pause] I shit and take 14 damage.

speaker: Travis
lines: Really? You should see a doctor, Griffin.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Next in the order is Taako.

speaker: Travis
lines: No wait wait wait— it just says “protection, when a creature you see attacks a target other than you when it’s in five feet—” oh, nope, you must be wielding a shield. Okay, nevermind!

speaker: Griffin
lines: I was about to say, what are you— “Hey you! Cut it out!”

speaker: Travis
lines: “Get your damn hands off him!”

speaker: Griffin
lines: “You get your damn… lobster claws off him!”

speaker: Travis
lines: No Biff- okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, Taako, it is your turn.

speaker: Justin
lines: Where is the- the thing has made its way into the train car, right?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, it’s ri- it’s right in front of you, yeah. Um, all of you are about, uh — you’re sort of clustered up together — about, uh, eight feet from the door that you came through?

speaker: Justin
lines: Okay. Okay. I cast Levitate on the crab.

speaker: Travis
lines: Nice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: It has to pass a constitution saving throw.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Constitution’s not this crab’s strong point, which I’m sure you’ll be happy to hear- glad to hear. Um, what is that— and then what. You just fuck— you levitate him?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, he floats for 10 minutes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughing] Okay, I didn’t know you can do that—

speaker: Justin
lines: And he can— well, you have to have a, I mean, if it’s unwilling, you have to pass a constitution saving throw.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Eleven? Yeah, it didn’t pass. Uh, ok, this crab is now levitating, how high and [laughing] what does that mean?

speaker: Justin
lines: You- it would float up to 20 feet… Um, right, at this point it can only, uh, move, uh… let me just—

speaker: Griffin
lines: If it uses another physical object to like, push itself?

speaker: Justin
lines: Yeah, it can push off a surface within reach. Uh, I can change the altitude by up to 20 feet in either direction on my turn. Can I say something as a free action?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Taako
lines: Knock it out! Of the train!

speaker: Merle
lines: Cool. You know basically, if you levitate it up to the roof you’ve got a crab on its back, not able to move.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, I wanna knock it out of the train!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Magnus, uh, it is your turn.

speaker: Travis
lines: Excellent, I’m gonna step up and Phantom Fist it out a window.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Ok —

speaker: Travis
lines: That is a… 17.

speaker: Griffin
lines: And you have to beat AC?

speaker: Travis
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh yeah, he has 16 AC, so—

speaker: Travis
lines: Nice.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —that connects.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uhhm. So that hits 1d4…

speaker: Griffin
lines: And don’t you get some sort of bonus, for your unarmed?

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, it does, it does. It’s um… 1d4, so I hit it for two, but I get to push it…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Um. And I’m gonna push it… through the window. So basically I’m punching it out a window.

speaker: Griffin
lines: The window is about, uh… six feet? Uh, which— to the left or the right? You’re basically in the center of the train right now.

speaker: Travis
lines: I mean, I’m punching it with my right fist, so—

speaker: Griffin
lines: So it would be towards the left.

speaker: Travis
lines: Yes.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh okay, you punch— and how far can you punch him with the Phantom Fist?

speaker: Travis
lines: I don’t know.

speaker: Griffin
lines: This pushes the target back 2d4 feet.

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh, okay. Great.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uhm. We will say because he’s experiencing some like, anti-gravity shit right now, we’ll bump that up to 3d4.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uhm. So you need to get 6 if you wanna try and—

speaker: Travis
lines: Four.

speaker: Griffin
lines: —get him out of the train—

speaker: Travis
lines: Six.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, yeah.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, ten.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, you punch him, uh, towards the left side of the train, he hits the glass and it shatters but he gets a chance to, uh, try and grab onto the sides of the train to avoid getting knocked out. Let’s do a straight up and down check, if it beats 10, then he manages to hold himself. Uh, he got an 11. So you punch him, he uh, his- his basically mouth side goes flying into the glass and shatters it, but he manages to stab his claws into either side of the window, and hold himself there without going out. But you did do some damage to him.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m gonna action surge and punch him again.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: I’m dedicated to this, I want this to happen real bad.

speaker: Justin
lines: This needs to happen.

speaker: Travis
lines: Uh, that is a 19.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Yeah, that does it. And you don— I guess you don’t need to roll for distance. You roll damage, so go ahead and hit him.

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, two… that’s another two… so all together I’ve hit him for eight damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: And- and punched him out a window.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Uhh. Same chance to resist —

speaker: Justin
lines: Wait a minute, why does he get a chance to resist Phantom Fist?

speaker: Griffin
lines: I- you- So if at any time you are being, uh, knocked off a ledge to your death, or being knocked into like a, hole or any situation where you are being killed with movement? Uh, you get a chance to— a- a reflex save to save yourself. Uh, the only other time you wouldn’t do that is if you’re like, asleep or unconscious or something. Uh, but that time he only rolled a seven. Uh, so you, uh— he is latched onto this window, you run out to him one more time and do like a jumping punch attack, uh, and his claws, his claw-knees buckle and, uh, he gets pushed out the window. You are on the inside of the tunnel, so he gets scraped up against the side of the tunnel and train, uh, and you- you see him move down the- the length of the train as it passes through this tunnel and he’s just sort of getting mashed up. Uh, he’s not outside of the car for very long when you see another burst of flame, and he sort of rocket propels himself, uh, back into the train about two cars down.

speaker: Travis
lines: Now hold on! Now…

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, but! Because he just got straight up grinded, uh, down the length of the train, we’ll say he took, uh, 2d12 damage from that. That’s a 10… And 11. Wowzers.

speaker: Travis
lines: And I hit him for eight.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Twenty-one. Yep.

speaker: Travis
lines: So he’s taken 29 points of damage.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah, and he is bloody, and he is further down the train, and that was pretty fucking radical.
